title: 108_hr2933
content: The Act may be cited as the "Critical Habitat Reform Act of 2004" and it pertains to the designation of critical habitat. The Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to designate critical habitat for endangered species or threatened species. The Secretary is required to issue a final regulation designating any habitat determined to be critical habitat to the maximum extent practicable. The Secretary must designate critical habitat for a species within one year of finalizing a recovery plan or within 3 years of determining the species as endangered or threatened. The designation can be revised periodically, and any area designated as critical habitat does not apply to authorized actions. The text chunk discusses the authorization of actions in designated critical habitat areas under specific permits, written statements, or conservation programs. It clarifies that the establishment of a recovery plan does not create regulatory requirements. Repeal of Section 4(b)(6)(C) of the Endangered Species Act of 1973. SEC. 3. BASIS FOR DETERMINATION. Section 4(b)(2) of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to include provisions for determining critical habitat, including seeking information from State and local governments and considering economic impacts. The Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to include provisions for determining critical habitat, considering economic impacts, and requiring the Secretary to first consider all areas known to be occupied by the species when designating critical habitat. The Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to include provisions for determining critical habitat, considering economic impacts, and requiring the Secretary to first consider all areas known to be occupied by the species when designating critical habitat. Section 4 outlines the content requirements for notices of proposed designation of critical habitat. Section 4(b)(5)(A) of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to include detailed requirements for publishing maps and coordinates when designating or revising critical habitat areas. The Endangered Species Act of 1973 now requires detailed publication of maps, coordinates, and field survey data for designated critical habitat areas on a publicly accessible Department internet page. SEC. 5. CLARIFICATION OF DEFINITION OF CRITICAL HABITAT. Section 3(5) of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to specify the areas that are considered critical habitat for endangered species, including geographical areas determined by field survey data and physical and biological features necessary for their continued existence. The Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to define critical habitat as geographical areas determined by field survey data that are essential for the survival of the species, including areas used for breeding, feeding, sheltering, or other essential behaviors.
